Hydras:

Hydras looked Tucson toughtfuly, this little nuisance resemble a l=
ot as Optimus Prime, if Rodimus didnt kill him he surely would


From: Sand=
y 
Sent: Wednesday, February 17, 2010 11:41 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com

Subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus/BlackFortress


  
Tucson continues to wait=
 patiently for Rodimus to make his move. If he were to strike the first blo=
w he knew he'd be putting himself on the same level as a Decepticon. True h=
e had hidden from Hydras and his merry men, and that was not indicative of =
Optimus yet a little bit of originality of Tucson, but, Tucson realized tha=
t this was serious and it had to be handled as such. His all wheel drive sy=
stems quickly kick in to give him strength in his legs, feet arms and hands=
. And now he takes on the same defensive poses as Optimus had taken when ba=
ttling against Megatron. It would almost seem as if Optimus were really rei=
ncarnated in Tucson, yet that was not the case.
He thinks to himself once a=
gain.

" I'm sure you wouldn't have wanted to do this either Optimus, and I=
 can see why that sometimes the hardest lessons are learned when you face a=
n enemy upon who has been your comrade for many years. But if this were you=
, I trust you would do the same."

He keeps his ears on his opponent, and h=
is sensors at the ready. The feeling inside him grows stronger and soon, he=
 feels metallic plates shifting once again, putting him in battle mode, wit=
h a shield over his face. He had not ever experienced the change into battl=
e mode quite like this, which now has him appearing a lot like Optimus yet =
smaller in size.

" All right, have it your way Rodimus. This is going to h=
urt me more than it will hurt you." 

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, <airly=
2002@...> wrote:
>
> DarkHawk/Hydras/Perceptor:
> 
> Darkhawk Waitted impat=
ient to set a blow, but he didnt liked to interfere. Hydras had a rrived an=

rived too and remai in silence

> From: Sandy

ruary 17, 2010 10:07 PM

> Subject: Re: Recove=
ring Rodimus/BlackFortre
> 
> 
> 
> Tucson nodds. And for the first time, e=
ven though he could not see from his eyes, it appears that he looks Rodimus=
 in the eyes, as Optimus would have done with Megatron many years ago. His =
expression stoic, as was Optimus Prime, and then out of nowhere he gives hi=
s reply.
> 
> " It doesn't have to come to this, Rodimus, but you leave me =
with no choice. One shall rise, and one shall fall." 
> 
> His voice had al=
ways sounded like Optimus when he was his age. But now, at this moment, it =
sounded more and more like the legendary Autobot leader. Now something insi=
de him was coming alive. A spirit that he had kept deep down within him and=
 now it was emerging. He did not cower in shock at the thought of going toe=
 to toe with Rodimus, although not thrilled with the idea, as Optimus would=
 have felt the same way, going against one of his own, but he knew it had t=
o be done. Perhaps it was the first step in hopefully recovering his lost l=
eader.
> 
> " It's clear to me that you have chosen the same path Megatron =
chose years ago. A path that lead to his demise. So, if this is the path yo=
u wish to take, then I fight you as an enemy."
> 
> His eyes do not narrow =
in rage, but take on a look of concentration. He'd need it if he was going =
to go against Rodimus.
> 
> " I'm ready."
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@...=
m, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@> wrote:
> >
> > 
> > >" Nothing comes eas=
y, and I'm aware of that. I'm not here to take the easy way out. I said I'd=
 do anything it took to restore my leader, and I am willing to stand by my =
pledge, no matter the cost to my own spark. So if it means comming dangerou=
sly close to my own mortality, I accept the challenge. I am willing to figh=
t anyone who wishes to challenge me, and I pledge to fight in Warrior's hon=
or." 
> > >
> > >He waits to find out who will take him up on his offer.
> =
> 
> > "Autobot" Scourge's dark tones move across the room as he watches Tu=
scon with narrow and dangerous optics, "You stand in the middle of Hydras' =
throne, sneaking in here like a tubo-rat, attacking from the back, and you =
ask us for honor?" 
> > 
> > Cyclonus nodded, "You ask for what you yoursel=
f are not ready to give." Cyclonus stepped foward, his optics glowing, his =
hands dropping to his sides and a deceptivly relaxed 'ready stance', "Yet i=
f it is a battle you desire, then you shall have it."
> > 
> > "NO!" Rodimu=
s' voice barked out as he stepped foward, his optics bright and his weapon =
ready! "It is me he came for, and it is *I* who will give him this battle."=

> > 
> > Cyclonus glanced back at Rodimus, the slightest hint of annoyance=
 sketching itself across his face for a moment. 
> > 
> > "Let the boy take=
 him" Scourge said as he stepped nearer to Cyclonus, a sly smile appearing =
on his face, "It will lets us know what he's made of."
> > 
> > Cyclonus pa=
used for a moment and then nodded, gesturing for Rodimus to step foward. "H=
e is yours."
> > 
> > Rodimus, after a slightly worried glance at Scourge a=
nd then Cyclonus, as if he was only just now realizing something, stepped f=
oward to face his new opponant. 
> > 
> > "I shall give you all the honor y=
ou have given us *Autobot!*" He said, That last word comming out almost as =
a curse. With all thoughts of any confusion on his part lost in his readine=
ss for battle the Dark Rodimus gestured to Tuscon, "Come, come to your doom=
!"
